column4: do you remember what you set the ssid as? You should look at that link I gave you for step by step instructions.
can you, in the phone, set that ssid rather than scan?
nope
it depends on whether or not your wifi nic will allow you to do ad hoc ics really. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing/
yeah, my ubuntu 12.04 has the ICS...
but i tried setting it up, but my Samsung Galaxy S2 running CyanogenMod 9 latest nightly build does not see it....
what am I missing here?
I have no idea. Either your ssid is not being broadcast, your nic does not allow adhoc due to limitations... or you didn't set it up right. What is your wifi nic?
how to check?
returns nothing
is this a usb wireless?
nope, it's built-in to my laptop (HP EliteBook 8540w)
can you please pastebin the output of: lspci
how do I pastebin?
i have pastebin installed in my ubuntu 12.04...but how do I use it on the command line?
did u see my pastebin i just sent to u?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1080801/
okie dokie
I don't think you should have a problem with that nic... I wouldn't expect it anyway.
that's weird....but my phone just can't discover the wifi
it means either your ssid is not broadcasting, or something went wrong during setup.
ssid not broadcasting? how do I make it broadcast?
i set it to "Private-AP"
